intro: Astripomoea polycephala, commonly known as the many-headed morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, round berries that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Astripomoea polycephala is often found growing along forest edges and in disturbed habitats due to its adaptability. Its rapid growth and ornamental flowers make it both a valued garden plant and a potential invasive species in some areas.
